fact_check_explanation_title: Reports that ‘most teachers’ are suffering from depression are based on a self-selecting survey
fact_check_explanation_summary: The data comes from members of the NASUWT teaching union who chose to complete its survey, so it can’t reliably tell us about the wellbeing of teachers as a whole.

fact_check_explanation_title: No hard evidence behind claim holidaymakers have 50% chance of ‘timely’ passport renewal
fact_check_explanation_summary: This figure is an estimate from an economic consultancy and doesn’t appear to be based on statistical data.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence hepatitis in children is caused by vaccinated breastfeeding mothers
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article shared on Facebook claims that most children with hepatitis were breastfed by fully vaccinated mothers.

fact_check_explanation_title: A man who arrived in Japan with a fake passport did not mysteriously vanish
fact_check_explanation_summary: It seems that the man himself was real, according to reports at the time. He was arrested, but we can find no evidence that he vanished—let alone that he came …

fact_check_explanation_title: Article 61 of the Magna Carta doesn’t mean you don’t have to pay council tax
fact_check_explanation_summary: Those liable do have to pay council tax, and nothing in the Magna Carta stops that being the case.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Lancet didn’t say Covid-19 vaccines are only 1% effective
fact_check_explanation_summary: This claim appears to be based on a misunderstanding of a 2021 article that suggested a different measure of effectiveness be published alongside the usual measure.

fact_check_explanation_title: NHS dentists are still operating in Somerset
fact_check_explanation_summary: A headline suggesting otherwise is not accurate. There is a reported shortage of appointments for new NHS patients, however.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Pfizer document’ doesn’t show company admitting vaccines unsafe in pregnancy
fact_check_explanation_summary: A screenshot of a supposed new document from Pfizer has been shared thousands of times but is out of date.

fact_check_explanation_title: Man wasn’t jailed only for staring at a woman on the train
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Spectator article recently claimed that a man had been sentenced to 22 weeks in prison after “continuously staring” at a woman.

fact_check_explanation_title: Harrier jets didn’t spell out expletive over Houses of Parliament
fact_check_explanation_summary: The farewell flypast for the jets didn’t even pass London.

fact_check_explanation_title: There were not 65,000 flu deaths in the winter of 2017/18
fact_check_explanation_summary: We’re not sure where this number comes from, but official estimates suggest it’s more than double the true figure.

fact_check_explanation_title: Some voting in local elections can pick more than one candidate
fact_check_explanation_summary: Until recently the Gov.uk website had given a misleading explanation of how to vote in local elections in England and Wales.
